SENT.plain: This study constructs a rat brain T(2) -weighted magnetic resonance imaging template including olfactory bulb and a compatible digital atlas
The atlas contains 624 carefully delineated brain structures based on the newest (2005) edition of rat brain atlas by Paxinos and Watson

An automated procedure, as an SPM toolbox, was introduced for spatially normalizing individual rat brains, conducting statistical analysis and visually localizing the results in the Atlas coordinate space
The brain template/atlas and the procedure were evaluated using functional images between rats with the right side middle cerebral artery occlusion (MCAO) and normal controls
The result shows that the brain region with significant signal decline in the MCAO rats was consistent with the occlusion position
